items.title: Medicine and Biotechnology
items.summary: Innovations in medicines and biotechnology have increased life expectancy and saved many lives. Explore how this happened, and how more progress can be made.

items.title: Top of the Charts: our most popular work in 2025
items.summary: A look back at the most popular charts, articles, data insights, and more from Our World in Data in 2025.

items.title: Almost all of the world’s mammal biomass is humans and livestock
items.summary: Humans and livestock make up 95% of the world’s mammal biomass; wild mammals are just 5%.

items.title: Just ten species make up almost half the weight of all wild mammals on Earth
items.summary: A small number of species dominate the distribution of wild mammal biomass.

items.title: The end of progress against extreme poverty?
items.summary: In the last three decades, the world has made progress against extreme poverty faster than ever before. But unless the poorest economies start growing, this period of progress against the worst form of poverty is over.
